Package org.gannacademy.cdf.graphics.ui

Class DrawingPanel

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
org.gannacademy.cdf.graphics.ui.DrawingPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class DrawingPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel

A drawing panel receives and displays all drawing instructions

In the default configuration (in which AppWindow is extended to construct a drawing), the drawing panel is contained by an AppWindow object — an AppWindow has-a DrawingPanel, in the parlance of the Advanced Placement exam, and a DrawingPanel has-many Drawable components.

Author:
Seth Battis
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • DrawingPanel

      public DrawingPanel()
      Construct a drawing panel of default dimensions and background color

    • DrawingPanel

      public DrawingPanel​(java.awt.Dimension dimension, java.awt.Color background)

      Construct a drawing panel with custom arguments

      Of potential interest: while setting a background color that is transparent reveals the light gray color of of the enclosing JFrame underneath the drawing panel, it will save as a transparent PNG using saveAs(String).

      Parameters:
      dimension - in pixels
      background - color

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add​(Drawable component)

      Add a drawable component to the drawing panel

      While available for use, this method does not usually need to be called manually -- it is automatically called by all Drawable component constructors. The Drawable.setDrawingPanel(DrawingPanel) method is meant to be used to move a Drawable component from one drawing panel to another transparently.

      Parameters:
      component - to be added

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(Drawable component)

      Remove a drawable component from the drawing panel

      While available for use, this method dos not usually need to be called manually -- it is automatically called by Drawable.removeFromDrawingPanel() and, if necessary, by Drawable.setDrawingPanel(DrawingPanel).

      Parameters:
      component - to be removed
      Returns:
      true if the component was present and removed, false otherwise

    • clear

      public void clear()

      Clear all drawable components from the drawing panel

      This does not destroy the drawable components — any references to these components outside of the drawing panel will still be valid, but the components will no longer refer to this drawing panel.

    • paintComponent

      public void paintComponent​(java.awt.Graphics graphics)

      Repaint the contents of the drawing panel (drawable components) as-needed

      This method is called automatically by the enclosing JFrame to repaint the drawing panel as needed. It is not meant to be called manually. If the drawing panel needs to be updated, a Component.repaint() request will schedule the update.

      This method calls the draw(Graphics2D) method to perform the actual drawing instructions

      Overrides:
      paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
      Parameters:
      graphics - context for drawing instructions
      See Also:
      draw(Graphics2D)

    • draw

      protected void draw​(java.awt.Graphics2D graphics)

      Request drawing instructions from all contained drawing components

      This method encapsulates all of the drawing instructions necessary to display the current drawable components. It is used by both the paintComponent(Graphics) method to update the display and the saveAs(String) method to write the current drawable components to a file.

      This method calls the preDraw(Graphics2D) method prior to making drawing instructions to set any rendering hints or other configuration for the drawing.

      Parameters:
      graphics - context for drawing instructions
      See Also:
      Drawable.draw(Graphics2D), preDraw(Graphics2D), paintComponent(Graphics), saveAs(String, String)

    • preDraw

      public void preDraw​(java.awt.Graphics2D graphics)

      Override this method to set custom graphics configurations

      This method is called by draw(Graphics2D) to configure any desired rendering hints or other preconfiguration before executing the actual drawing instructions.

      Parameters:
      graphics - context for drawing commands

    • saveAs

      public boolean saveAs​(java.lang.String path)
      Save the current drawing panel as a file using the default format
      Parameters:
      path - relative to the current working directory
      Returns:
      true if the file was successfully written, false otherwise

    • saveAs

      public boolean saveAs​(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String format)
      Save the current drawing panel as a file
      Parameters:
      path - relative to the current working directory
      format - of the image file (e.g. "PNG"
      Returns:
      true if the file was successfully written, false otherwise
